Problem:
Suppose we have a linear system governed by the differential equation \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\), where D is a diagonal matrix. Consider the effect of applying a linear transformation \\( T(x) = Mx \\) where M is a square matrix, at various times.

If \\( T(x) \\) is applied to a vector \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0, and it evolves according to \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\) until time T without further intervention, will the vector \\( x(T) \\) be the same as if \\( x_0 \\) was simply allowed to evolve under \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\) to time T?
Explanation: Applying the transformation \\( T(x) \\) modifies the initial condition to \\( Mx_0 \\). The evolution under \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\) from this new initial condition generally leads to a different state at time T, particularly if M is not a scalar multiple of the identity matrix.
